title: Inquiry-Based Integrated Mathematics and Science Education Program Design for Low-Achieving Elementary Students

context.prior_knowledge: Grasp of basic scientific concepts, ability to use experimental tools, and foundational skills in calculations and graph interpretation
context.additional_context: A teaching competency enhancement program for pre-service or in-service teachers. Conducted as after-school supplementary education for low-income elementary students. Combines digital devices (data visualization tools) and offline inquiry activities to enhance learning motivation, scientific thinking, and mathematical problem-solving skills

learning_goals: Students enhance their ability to observe daily phenomena and generate questions by integrating scientific inquiry processes with mathematical analysis methods.

Students accurately perform the process of hypothesis verification and conclusion derivation through experimental design and data analysis (organizing measurements, creating graphs, statistical verification, etc.) with over 80% accuracy.

Learners collaborate in teams of 4â€“5 members, incorporate peer feedback at least twice, and produce a 15-page inquiry report (including mathematical modeling and scientific analysis). They achieve a grade of B or higher in at least four out of five rubric criteria: clarity of topic, logical coherence, fidelity of evidence, creativity, and feedback incorporation.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
